header: Mrs. Snehal Suresh Jagtap Vs. The State of Maharashtra ( Sinhgad road Police Station)

background.text: Order below Exh. 4 in Cri. Bail Application No.204/2019 The applicant­ accused has filed present application for ad­interim anticipatory bail u/s.438 of Cr.P.C. in connection with C.R. No.41/2019 registered with Sinhgad Road Police Station, for the offences punishable u/s. 417, 419 r/w.s 34 of the Indian Penal Code and u/s. 5 and 8 of the Maharashtra Educational Institute ( Prohibition of Capitation Fees) Act 1987. Perused record. Heard advocate of applicant/accused. It seems that on the basis of report lodged by Prasad Kulkarni­ Deputy Registrar, Savitribai Phule, Pune University, Pune, a crime No.41/2019 came to be registered at Sinhgad Police Station, for the offences punishable u/s. 417, 419 r/w.s 34 of the Indian Penal Code and u/s. 5 and 8 of the Maharashtra Educational Institute ( Prohibition of Capitation Fees) Act 1987.

legalActFound.stringMatched: u/s.438 of cr.p.c. in connection with c.r. no.41/2019 registered with sinhgad road police station, for the offences punishable u/s. 417, 419 r/w.s 34 of the indian penal code

arguments.text: Learned Advocate for applicant/accused submitted that Snehal Jagtap has sustained injury to her right hand finger, therefore, she was unable to write answer papers, therefore, she was permitted to write answer papers through writer Anurag Jain. He further submitted that there is no whisper in the complaint about any amount of donation given or accepted by the accused persons. Therefore, section 5 and 8 of the Maharashtra Educational Institute ( Prohibition of Capitation Fees) Act 1987 not affected. On perusing record, it seems that before filing FIR, applicants have filed another application for anticipatory bail , in 2 which, order of notice of 72 hours was made. Therefore, considering all these facts, in my view, it is necessary to give interim protection to applicant/accused till filing of say by opponent. Hence I pass following order.

argumentSentences.text: Learned Advocate for applicant/accused submitted that Snehal Jagtap has sustained injury to her right hand finger, therefore, she was unable to write answer papers, therefore, she was permitted to write answer papers through writer Anurag Jain.
He further submitted that there is no whisper in the complaint about any amount of donation given or accepted by the accused persons.
Therefore, section 5 and 8 of the Maharashtra Educational Institute ( Prohibition of Capitation Fees) Act 1987 not affected.
On perusing record, it seems that before filing FIR, applicants have filed another application for anticipatory bail , in 2 which, order of notice of 72 hours was made.
Therefore, considering all these facts, in my view, it is necessary to give interim protection to applicant/accused till filing of say by opponent.

order.text: ORDER i. Application (Exh.4) is allowed. ii In the event of arrest of applicant ­accused­ Mrs. Snehal Suresh Jagtap, she be released on ad­interim anticipatory bail on furnishing P.R. Bond in a sum of Rs.25,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount till next date. iii. This interim protection shall be remained in force till next date. iv. The applicant­ accused shall not leave India without permission of the Court. vii. Issue show cause notice to respondents why ad­interim anticipatory bail should not made absolute. Returnable on 18/01/2019 viii. Inform concerned police station accordingly.

footer: Date : 11/01/2019 (K.D.Vadane) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. 3 “I affirm that the contents of the PDF file order are same word to word as per original judgment.” Name of Steno : Shri S. B. Gore, Stenographer Grade­I Court Name : K.D. Vadane , Addl. Sessions Judge, Pune Date : 11/01/2019 order signed by presiding officer on : 11/01/2019 Order uploaded on : 11/01/2019
processedText:
Mrs. Snehal Suresh Jagtap Vs. The State of Maharashtra ( Sinhgad road Police Station) 
---header-ends---
Order below Exh. 4 in Cri. Bail Application No.204/2019 The applicant­ accused has filed present application for ad­interim anticipatory bail u/s.438 of Cr.P.C. in connection with C.R. No.41/2019 registered with Sinhgad Road Police Station, for the offences punishable u/s. 417, 419 r/w.s 34 of the Indian Penal Code and u/s. 5 and 8 of the Maharashtra Educational Institute ( Prohibition of Capitation Fees) Act 1987. Perused record. Heard advocate of applicant/accused. It seems that on the basis of report lodged by Prasad Kulkarni­ Deputy Registrar, Savitribai Phule, Pune University, Pune, a crime No.41/2019 came to be registered at Sinhgad Police Station, for the offences punishable u/s. 417, 419 r/w.s 34 of the Indian Penal Code and u/s. 5 and 8 of the Maharashtra Educational Institute ( Prohibition of Capitation Fees) Act 1987. 
---background-ends---
Learned Advocate for applicant/accused submitted that Snehal Jagtap has sustained injury to her right hand finger, therefore, she was unable to write answer papers, therefore, she was permitted to write answer papers through writer Anurag Jain. He further submitted that there is no whisper in the complaint about any amount of donation given or accepted by the accused persons. Therefore, section 5 and 8 of the Maharashtra Educational Institute ( Prohibition of Capitation Fees) Act 1987 not affected. On perusing record, it seems that before filing FIR, applicants have filed another application for anticipatory bail , in 2 which, order of notice of 72 hours was made. Therefore, considering all these facts, in my view, it is necessary to give interim protection to applicant/accused till filing of say by opponent. Hence I pass following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER i. Application (Exh.4) is allowed. ii In the event of arrest of applicant ­accused­ Mrs. Snehal Suresh Jagtap, she be released on ad­interim anticipatory bail on furnishing P.R. Bond in a sum of Rs.25,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount till next date. iii. This interim protection shall be remained in force till next date. iv. The applicant­ accused shall not leave India without permission of the Court. vii. Issue show cause notice to respondents why ad­interim anticipatory bail should not made absolute. Returnable on 18/01/2019 viii. Inform concerned police station accordingly. 
---order-ends---
Date : 11/01/2019 (K.D.Vadane) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. 3 “I affirm that the contents of the PDF file order are same word to word as per original judgment.” Name of Steno : Shri S. B. Gore, Stenographer Grade­I Court Name : K.D. Vadane , Addl. Sessions Judge, Pune Date : 11/01/2019 order signed by presiding officer on : 11/01/2019 Order uploaded on : 11/01/2019
